_header: In a summer season when soft was the sun
Note: See also for ‘A’ Texts 2458; for ‘B’ Texts, see 2459; for former 745, see Cambridge UK, Gonville & Caius College 669/646 copy of 2460.
Subjects: dream visions; sins, deadly; prayers, asked on behalf of scribes; scribes; penitence
_description: William Langland, Vision of Piers Plowman, the ‘C’ text

BodLauMis656.First Lines:
In a somer seson whan softe was þe sonneI schope in to
                    schrebbes as I ascheperde were…
BodLauMis656.Last Lines:
…& sende me hape & hele til ic haue pers plouman&
                    siþ he grade after grace til ich gan a wake
BodLauMis656.Attributed Title:
Incipit Piers Plowman (f. 19v); Explicit passus
                        secundus de dobest incipit passus tercius (f. 114)

BodDig102.First Lines:
To fette ffauel forth floreynes ynoweAnd bad Gyle to gyue gold al
                    aboute…
BodDig102.Last Lines:
…And sende me hap & hele til y haue Peres PlouhmanAnd seth
                    he gradde aftur Grace tyl y gan awake
BodDig102.Note:
‘C’ Text, III.160-end. At the end: ‘Explicit
                    etc’. Written as prose.

BodDig171.First Lines:
Drede stod atte dore and þat deone herdeWhat þe kynges
                    wille was and wiȝteliche he went…
BodDig171.Last Lines:
…And mad merþe with þis mete ac y mornede euereffor
                    a doctor at þe heie deye drank wyn faste

Bod851.First Lines:
In a somer sesoun wen softe was the sonne y schope me in to
                    schrodue As y A schep were…
Bod851.Last Lines:
…And sende hap & hele tyl y haue perijs plowman seþe
                    he gradde after grace til y gan a wake
Bod851.Facsimiles:
Brewer,  Charlotte,  and  A. George Rigg.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Piers Plowman. A Facsimile of the Z-Text in Bodleian, Oxford, MS Bodley
                851.
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1994.

BodDou104.First Lines:
IN a sommur sesoun whan softe was þe sonneI shop me in to
                    schrudes as y a schep were…
BodDou104.Last Lines:
…& send me halp & hole to I haue peres þe
                    ploughmanAnd sith he gred after grace til I can a wake
BodDou104.Facsimiles:
Pearsall,  Derek,
                        ed.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Piers Plowman. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Douce
                104.
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1992.

CULDd313.First Lines:
Concience andn þe kynges yn to court wenteWhere houede an
                    hundryd yn houves of selke…
CULDd313.Last Lines:
…Philosofres fursoken welþe for þey wolde be
                    needy& wonede wel elingly & wolde nat be riche

CULFf535.First Lines:
IN a somur sesoun whanne softe was þe sunneI schep me in to
                    schrubbes a schepard as I were…
CULFf535.Last Lines:
…and send me hap & heletil Ihaue perus plowman& sith
                    he gradde aftur grace til I gan awake

CULAdd4325.First Lines:
IN a somerus sesun whan softe was þe sonneI schop me in to
                    schrobbes as y aschepherde wer…
CULAdd4325.Last Lines:
…And syþþe he gradde after grace tyl I gan
                        awakeExplicit passus secundus de dobest

CamCCC293.First Lines:
In a somerus sesone whan softe was þe sonneI shoop me in to
                    schrubbes as I a shepherde were…
CamCCC293.Last Lines:
…And send me hap & hele il y haue perus plowmanAnd
                    siþþe he gradde after gracce til y ga a wake

CamGon669.First Lines:
Euery man þat haþ his mynde with liberum arbitriumAnd
                    whan y wilne oþer wolde annus y hyȝte…
CamGon669.Last Lines:
……And whan y fle fro þe flesch & fey lene þe
                    careyneþan am y spira specheles & spiritus þan y
                    hote…
CamGon669.Note:
A fragment/extract from C-Text of Piers Plowman, Passus XVI, lines
                    181-197, omitting line 182 and lines 198-200 — 16, alliterative unrhymed
                    lines plus Latin prose; added to originally blank leaf at end of volume, signed,
                    ‘quod Johannes Cok’ (as is a copy of the Pater Noster on p. 1);
                    owned by John Shirley (his motto and design, f. iiv, name f. iii);
                    Robert Sheringham, DD, Fellow of Gonville & Caius (f. ii, p. 2); formerly
                        745.

BLAdd34779.First Lines:
IN a somur sesoun…t was þe sonne I shoop me into shrowde
                    as y a sh…erd…
BLAdd34779.Last Lines:
…Hende speche hyght pees open þe…attesLat yn
                    þe frere & his felowe & make hem fair cheer
BLAdd34779.Note:
‘C’ Text. Manuscript faded, so some text indecipherable.
                    Ends imperfectly, with final six lines on f. 93v added by a later
                    hand.

BLAdd35157.First Lines:
In a somer sesoun when soft was þe sonneI shoep me in to
                    shrowdes as y a shep were…
BLAdd35157.Last Lines:
…And sende me happe & hele til y haue pers ploughmanAnd
                    sithe he gradde after grace til y gan awake
BLAdd35157.Note:
‘C’ Text. Scribe signs f. 124
                            ‘ Preston’, or
                    ‘Prestoun’.

BLCottVesBXVI.First Lines:
In a somer seson whan softe was þe sonneI schop me in to
                    schrobbes as I a schepherde were…
BLCottVesBXVI.Last Lines:
…And sende me hap and hele til I haue peres plouhmanAnd
                    seþþe he gradde after grace til I gan a wake
BLCottVesBXVI.Attributed Title:
Piers Plowman (added seventeenth century, top margin folio 1; Explicit
                        secundus passus de dobest (f. 95)

BLHar2376.First Lines: In a Somer Seysoun whan softe was þe SonneI Shope me into Shrowes as y a Shepeherd were…
BLHar2376.Last Lines: …& sende me happe & hele tyl y haue peres plouȝman And syþþe he gradde aftere grace til y ganne a wake
BLHar2376.Note: ‘C’ Text. After last line, “Hic explicit passus secundus de do best” (f. 124)
BLHar2376.Attributed Title: Here bygynneþ þe boke of Pyris Plowman (rubric, f. 1)
BLHar2376.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2376.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_2376.

BLRoy18Bxvii.First Lines:
In somer season whan softe was the sonnI shope me in to shrobbes as
                    I shepharde wer…
BLRoy18Bxvii.Last Lines:
…and sende hape and hele tyll y haue peres ploughemanand
                    sythen he grade after grace tyll I be gane to waken
BLRoy18Bxvii.Note:
Copied in a sixteenth-century hand, same as text on ff.
                    1-13v.

TCD212.First Lines:
In assomur seson wan softe was þe sonneY shop me in to
                    schrobbus as y a schepurde were…
TCD212.Last Lines:
…Hadden pryked and preyed polles of peopleLargeliche a legyon
                    lees þe lyf sone
TCD212.Note: ‘C’ Text, Prologue to XXII.87; heavily glossed.
TCD212.Attributed Title: Hic incipit uisio Willelmi de Petro Plouhman (f. 1)

UnivLonSLV17.First Lines:
IN a somur sesoun whan softe was þe sonneI schop me in to
                    schrobbes as y a schepherde were…
UnivLonSLV17.Last Lines:
…Hadden prycked and preyed polles of peopleLargelyche a
                    legyoun lees þe lyf sone. Amen
UnivLonSLV17.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit uisio Willelmus de Petro Ploushman (f. 1,
                    rubric)

UnivLonSLV88.First Lines:
…ele to make with her papelotes…greedeþ after
                    foode…
UnivLonSLV88.Last Lines:
Of eny kyne catell but knoweleched him souereynBoþe of sande
                    sonne & see and sennes þey we[?]e…
UnivLonSLV88.Note:
‘C’ Text, I.56-end, missing several leaves; transcript by
                    Skeat and Hall in Cambridge UK,  Trinity College R.2.36 (536), ff. 2-230 (= ff. 40-112 of original).
                    First folio so damaged that little that remains is legible. Transcription
                    commences with first two lines on f. 2, on which the first part of most lines is
                    also illegible. As the final folios are also very damaged, o the transcription
                    includes the last two [nearly] completely legible lines on f.
                    112v.

HunHM137.First Lines:
IN asomere seyson whan softe was þe sonneY shop in to shrobbis
                    as y shepherde were…
HunHM137.Last Lines:
…And sende me hap and hele til ich haue peers plouhmanAnd
                    suthe he gradde after grace til ich gan awake
HunHM137.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit Visio Willelmi de petro plouhman (f. 1, originally
                    rubric, mostly erased); Hic explicit passus secundus de dobest. Explicit
                        peers plouheman scriptum per Thomam Dankastre (f.
                    89v)
HunHM137.Editions:
Bad Key: Whitaker1813. 
Skeat,  Walter William,
                        ed.  
             William Langland: The Vision of Piers Plowman.
            Vol. 3: Text C.
             EETS
         o.s. 54 (1873); repr. 1978.

HunHM143.Transcription:
In a somer seson when softe was þe sunney schop me to a schrobbe
                    as y a schep wereIn habit of an Ermyte vnholy of werkesWente forth in
                    þe world wondres…
HunHM143.Note:
On the back pastedown. ‘C’ Text, second occurrence in MS; a
                    false start, fifteenth-century hand different from that of either 5248 or the whole text of 2460 in
                    this MS; with the name ‘Ihon redbery’ written above by a different
                    hand from these four lines of text.

YaleBeiOsfa45.First Lines:
…ant þe graffe of grace and grayþest wity is he[
                    ]ffor thy y may seye as y sayd eere by shit of thys [ ]…
YaleBeiOsfa45.Last Lines:
…[ ]asse prisones payeth for hem ofte[ ]iaylers gold &
                    grotes to gidderes…
YaleBeiOsfa45.Note:
‘C’ Text, fragmentary bifolium, damaged along leading edges
                    of leaves; corresponds to 1.200-3.174. Olim
                    Oslo and London,  Schøyen Collection [Piers Plowman fragment [olim Holloway, Old Vicarage, Wickhambrook,
            Suffolk, olim Hanna].
YaleBeiOsfa45.Facsimiles:
Hanna,  Ralph. 
             “Studies in the Mansucripts of Piers Plowman.” 
             The Yearbook of Langland Studies
         7 (1993): 1-26: frontis (opposite 1).
